meanings.definition: A fabric with a raised woven design.
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of soft cloque fabric.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate cloque pattern on the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The cloque material added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The cloque texture felt like a gentle wave under her fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The cloque weave created a beautiful 3D effect on the fabric.

meanings.definition: To create a raised woven design on fabric.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cloqued the fabric to add texture.
meanings.sent2: The artisan cloqued the cloth with precision.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cloque the pillow covers for a unique look.
meanings.sent4: Her skilled hands cloqued the material into a stunning pattern.
meanings.sent5: Cloquing the fabric transformed it into a work of art.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a puckered or blistered appearance.
meanings.sent1: The designer used cloque fabric for the avant-garde collection.
meanings.sent2: The skirt shimmered in the light, showcasing the cloque texture.
meanings.sent3: The cloque material added a modern twist to the traditional design.
meanings.sent4: Her gown resembled a field of flowers in the delicate cloque.
meanings.sent5: The cloque fabric gave the outfit a unique and stylish look.
